bioghist.p: John A. Van den Broek was born in Middleharnis, Holland on March 6, 1885. He emigrated to the United States in 1905. He received his B.S. degree from the University of Kansas in 1911 and his Ph.D. from the University of Michigan in 1918. Beginning in 1914, Van den Broek was a member of the faculty of the University. He became full professor of engineering mechanics in 1926. He was the author of professional monographs, including Elastic Energy Theory (1942) and Theory of Limit Design (1945). He died April 20, 1959.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence and other professional materials, most relating to his research and other responsibilities at the University of Michigan. Of note are his Reports on automobile wheel tests for Hayes Wheel Company, 1923-1926, and a report on high strength aluminum alloys written during World War II.
